abstract: The activist investor Carl C. Icahn is seeking a seat for himself and three associates on the board of the Genzyme Corporation, posing a new challenge to the management of the embattled biotechnology company, The New York Times reported.
snippet: The activist investor Carl C. Icahn is seeking a seat for himself and three associates on the board of the Genzyme Corporation, posing a new challenge to the management of the embattled biotechnology company, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The activist investor Carl C. Icahn is seeking a seat for himself and three associates on the board of Genzyme, posing a new challenge to the management of the embattled biotechnology company, The New York Times’s Andrew Pollack reports.

headline.main: Icahn Seeks 4 Seats on Genzyme Board
